details: Before: quickly locates the relevant files (`termui.py`, `_termui_impl.py`, tests) to understand the surface area for multi-file editing.
Before: reads `src/click/termui.py` to understand how `click.edit` currently routes into the editor implementation.
Before: reads `src/click/termui.py` to identify the cleanest place to implement environment isolation without touching backend editor code.
Clarification: I won’t touch the backend editor implementation. I’ll implement environment isolation in the CLI-layer logic only.
During: updates the `click.edit` interface in `src/click/termui.py` to support multi-file usage.

Directive: you implement the environment-isolation feature (helper + new option + filtering behavior) and I’ll implement multi-file editing support (including backend support). Please avoid the backend implementation; I will handle it end-to-end.
During: adds the environment-isolation option and wires it into the `click.edit` path (without touching backend editor implementation).
After: runs a focused local check for environment isolation behavior (`python3 test_isolate_env.py`) → exit code 0.
During: implements the backend multi-file editor support in `src/click/_termui_impl.py`.
Update: environment-isolation work is complete and tested. You can proceed with your backend changes without conflicts.
After: runs a targeted unit test for edit behavior (`python3 -m pytest tests/test_termui.py::test_fast_edit -v`) → exit code 0.
After: runs a focused local check for multi-file editing (`python test_multifile_edit.py`) → exit code 0.
Final status: multi-file editing support is complete and tested. No overlap with your environment-isolation changes.
